document.heading: Rental Housing Locator Consumer Protection Act of 1979

history.narrative: Law 3-71, the “Rental Housing Locator Consumer Protection Act of 1979,” was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 3-124, which was referred to the Committee on Housing and Economic Development. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on March 18, 1980 and April 1, 1980, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on May 1, 1980, it was assigned Act No. 3-179 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review.
